moves.6. Qh5 Be6: ? This was the mistake that decided the game. He couldn't recover from it.
moves.7. Bxe6: *note to those who are interested. The f-pawn is pinned.*
moves.7... g6: ? On the outside this is good. But look down at b2!
moves.8... Kxf7 9. Qd5+: Forking the King and the b-pawn.
moves.12. Bxf6: Again a pin wins a piece.
moves.12... Nd7 13. Nc3: ?? What in the world made me do that?
moves.18... Kc7 19. O-O: I get my other rook into play.
moves.19... Re8 20. Ng5: Only way to keep the pawn.
moves.21... h6 22. Nd5+ Kb8 23. Nf6 Re7 24. Ng: My knights are connected. His queen side looks a bit threatening.
moves.27... a5 28. Rcb1: Not sure what was possessing me...
moves.28... Rb7 29. Nd5: The board had been screaming for this move a long time ago.
moves.33. Nec7 c4 34. Kf2 Nd3+: !? Just makes me do what I was going to do anyway.
moves.40. axb4 axb4 41. Rxb4 Nd3+ 42. Rxd3 cxd: He resigned. My rook would clean up and he would be in Old Matey's grasp.
